content.text: {"translationLines":[{"lineNumber":261532,"originalJapaneseLine":"（自由都市１での内容のおさらい、自由都市１でランス達は出会っている）","translatedEnglishLine":"(A recap of the events in Free City 1, where Rance and others met.)"},{"lineNumber":261533,"originalJapaneseLine":"科学者、クソガキ","translatedEnglishLine":"Scientist, brat"},{"lineNumber":261534,"originalJapaneseLine":"人造兵器を作る・・　シーザーの方がかっこいい","translatedEnglishLine":"Creating artificial weapons... Caesar's are cooler."},{"lineNumber":261535,"originalJapaneseLine":"特にやっかいのが衛星兵器・・ランスに協力してもらったバグうんぬん","translatedEnglishLine":"The particularly troublesome one was the satellite weapon... the bugs that Rance helped with and all that."},{"lineNumber":261536,"originalJapaneseLine":"あれにはほんとてこずった","translatedEnglishLine":"That really gave us a hard time."},{"lineNumber":261537,"originalJapaneseLine":"後、メカバボラとかもあったな・・あれは強かったけど、やはりやばいのは衛星兵器だった","translatedEnglishLine":"Also, there was Mecha Babora or something... that was strong, but the satellite weapon was definitely the most dangerous."},{"lineNumber":261538,"originalJapaneseLine":"でももう倒したら大丈夫。","translatedEnglishLine":"But since we defeated it, it’s alright now."},{"lineNumber":261539,"originalJapaneseLine":"　","translatedEnglishLine":""},{"lineNumber":261540,"originalJapaneseLine":"ランスがマリアに聞く、そういえばあの時、奴の作ったロボットの破片を回収したんだろ","translatedEnglishLine":"Rance asks Maria, by the way, you recovered pieces of the robot he made back then, right?"},{"lineNumber":261541,"originalJapaneseLine":"研究して何か分かったのか・・","translatedEnglishLine":"Did your research uncover anything?"},{"lineNumber":261542,"originalJapaneseLine":"うう、わかんないのー技術格差がある話","translatedEnglishLine":"Ugh, I don’t know—there’s a technological gap, you see."},{"lineNumber":261543,"originalJapaneseLine":"５０名ほどの魔物軍と遭遇、チューリップを見ると逃げて行く","translatedEnglishLine":"Encountered a monster army of about 50; when they see the Tulip, they flee."},{"lineNumber":261544,"originalJapaneseLine":"うわっ・・鉄のオバケだ・・あれは痛い、にげろー","translatedEnglishLine":"Whoa... an iron ghost... that’s dangerous, run!"},{"lineNumber":261545,"originalJapaneseLine":"マリアえっへん","translatedEnglishLine":"Maria, ahem."},{"lineNumber":261546,"originalJapaneseLine":"ランスが軽く言う","translatedEnglishLine":"Rance says lightly."},{"lineNumber":261547,"originalJapaneseLine":"役に立つ武器だ、ヘルマンとの戦いの時も強かった","translatedEnglishLine":"It’s a useful weapon; it was strong even during the battle with Hellman."},{"lineNumber":261548,"originalJapaneseLine":"これに乗って戦うのは爽快だったぞ","translatedEnglishLine":"Fighting while riding this was exhilarating."},{"lineNumber":261549,"originalJapaneseLine":"もっと早く、これを量産していればいいの、もったいない","translatedEnglishLine":"It would’ve been great if they mass-produced these sooner; such a waste."},{"lineNumber":261550,"originalJapaneseLine":"チューリップ１号だっけ、あの小型大砲や、２号という大型の固定大砲より","translatedEnglishLine":"The Tulip No.1, right? Compared to that small cannon and the larger fixed cannon called No.2,"},{"lineNumber":261551,"originalJapaneseLine":"ずっと役に立つだろう","translatedEnglishLine":"it’s much more useful."},{"lineNumber":261552,"originalJapaneseLine":"てな事を言うと、技術者の何かふれたらしく噛みつかれる","translatedEnglishLine":"When I say things like that, some engineer takes offense and bites back."},{"lineNumber":261553,"originalJapaneseLine":"わかってない","translatedEnglishLine":"They say I don’t understand."},{"lineNumber":261554,"originalJapaneseLine":"　絶対に無理、材料、製造、メンテ等　大変","translatedEnglishLine":"It’s absolutely impossible—materials, manufacturing, maintenance, all are difficult."},{"lineNumber":261555,"originalJapaneseLine":"　それにこのＨ型の前のＧ型というタイプがあったのだけど","translatedEnglishLine":"Also, before this H model, there was a type called G model."},{"lineNumber":261556,"originalJapaneseLine":"　それはリーザスに納品した２両は１週間で動かなくなった","translatedEnglishLine":"The two units delivered to Leesus stopped working within a week."},{"lineNumber":261557,"originalJapaneseLine":"　やっとドイツ回路を発明してこのＨ型から安定してうんぬん","translatedEnglishLine":"Finally, after inventing the German circuit, this H model became stable and so on."},{"lineNumber":261558,"originalJapaneseLine":"　それに１号は携帯用で、２号は大火力として圧倒的に有効で","translatedEnglishLine":"The No.1 is portable, and No.2 is overwhelmingly effective as heavy artillery,"},{"lineNumber":261559,"originalJapaneseLine":"　あれこれ・・どんどんいい","translatedEnglishLine":"and all that... it just keeps getting better."},{"lineNumber":261560,"originalJapaneseLine":"ああ、やっかいな事をいってしまったな、よし話をかえよう","translatedEnglishLine":"Ah, I said something troublesome. Alright, let’s change the subject."},{"lineNumber":261561,"originalJapaneseLine":"これタイヤにしたらいいんじゃないか、馬車にあるような","translatedEnglishLine":"Wouldn’t it be better to make these into tires, like those on carriages?"},{"lineNumber":261562,"originalJapaneseLine":"すると、キャタピラでないと駄目なのとうんちく","translatedEnglishLine":"Then they lecture me that it has to be caterpillar tracks."},{"lineNumber":261563,"originalJapaneseLine":"・・・・","translatedEnglishLine":"...."},{"lineNumber":261564,"originalJapaneseLine":"道中、チューリップ３号Ｈのキャタピラが外れる","translatedEnglishLine":"During the journey, the caterpillar track of Tulip No.3 H comes off."},{"lineNumber":261565,"originalJapaneseLine":"修理の為に休憩となる","translatedEnglishLine":"They take a break to do repairs."},{"lineNumber":261566,"originalJapaneseLine":"マリアをおちょくる","translatedEnglishLine":"Teasing Maria."},{"lineNumber":261567,"originalJapaneseLine":"パイアールが現れた、タンクを連れてきた。","translatedEnglishLine":"P.A.R. appears, bringing a tank with him."},{"lineNumber":261568,"originalJapaneseLine":"面倒だけど君のその戦車潰しておかないと大将軍が困るんだよ","translatedEnglishLine":"It’s troublesome, but if we don’t destroy your tank, the Grand General will be in trouble."},{"lineNumber":261569,"originalJapaneseLine":"マリア　うてーうてー　かーんかーん　跳ね返される","translatedEnglishLine":"Maria: Shoot, shoot! Clang clang! It’s deflected back."},{"lineNumber":261570,"originalJapaneseLine":"うたれてチューリップ大破、全然勝てない　マリア泣く","translatedEnglishLine":"Hit and the Tulip is heavily damaged; they can’t win at all. Maria cries."},{"lineNumber":261571,"originalJapaneseLine":"俺様がなんとかしてやる","translatedEnglishLine":"I’ll do something about this."},{"lineNumber":261572,"originalJapaneseLine":"ランスが攻め込む","translatedEnglishLine":"Rance launches an attack."},{"lineNumber":261573,"originalJapaneseLine":"ああ、壊れちゃったよ。","translatedEnglishLine":"Ah, it broke."},{"lineNumber":261574,"originalJapaneseLine":"問題点は分かったし、しかたないなぁ新型作るよ","translatedEnglishLine":"I understood the problems, so there’s no choice—I’ll make a new model."},{"lineNumber":261575,"originalJapaneseLine":"と立ち去る","translatedEnglishLine":"And he leaves."},{"lineNumber":261576,"originalJapaneseLine":"こら、まてと追いかけるが逃げられてしまう","translatedEnglishLine":"They chase after him saying “Hey, wait!” but he escapes."},{"lineNumber":261577,"originalJapaneseLine":"Ｍランド司令部","translatedEnglishLine":"M-Land Headquarters"},{"lineNumber":261578,"originalJapaneseLine":"マリア、科学には科学だ、これを超える兵器を作るのだ","translatedEnglishLine":"Maria, science with science—create a weapon that surpasses this."},{"lineNumber":261579,"originalJapaneseLine":"と壊れたタンクの破片を解析しているマリアに言う","translatedEnglishLine":"He says this to Maria, who is analyzing the broken tank fragments."},{"lineNumber":261580,"originalJapaneseLine":"・・・やっぱり、わかんない、なにこれ","translatedEnglishLine":"...Still, I don’t understand. What is this?"},{"lineNumber":261581,"originalJapaneseLine":"ランスはマリアに対抗手段を作れと命じる。お前なら出来る","translatedEnglishLine":"Rance orders Maria to create a countermeasure. 'You can do it.'"},{ "lineNumber":261582,"originalJapaneseLine":"必死で作るが、出来ない・・　無能、アホとののしる","translatedEnglishLine":"She desperately tries but can’t do it... insulted as useless and idiot."},{"lineNumber":261583,"originalJapaneseLine":"（マリアとは圧倒的な科学力の差）","translatedEnglishLine":"(There’s an overwhelming technological gap compared to Maria.)"},{"lineNumber":261584,"originalJapaneseLine":"　","translatedEnglishLine":""},{"lineNumber":261585,"originalJapaneseLine":"そこにダークランスが現れる（マリアとは自由都市１で会っている）","translatedEnglishLine":"Then Dark Rance appears (he met Maria back in Free City 1)."},{"lineNumber":261586,"originalJapaneseLine":"情けない男だ、これが俺の父親とは・・","translatedEnglishLine":"What a pathetic man. To think this is my father..."},{"lineNumber":261587,"originalJapaneseLine":"女に頼って自分の力でなんとかしようとしないとはな","translatedEnglishLine":"Relying on a woman, not trying to manage things by his own strength."},{"lineNumber":261588,"originalJapaneseLine":"なにーとランスが怒るといなくなる","translatedEnglishLine":"When Rance gets angry and says 'What?!', he disappears."},{"lineNumber":261589,"originalJapaneseLine":"（　マリア、ダークランスあたりの雰囲気で調整）","translatedEnglishLine":"(Adjusting the atmosphere between Maria and Dark Rance.)"},{"lineNumber":261590,"originalJapaneseLine":"　","translatedEnglishLine":""},{"lineNumber":261591,"originalJapaneseLine":"どこかに、そういやクルックーを昨晩からみないな","translatedEnglishLine":"Somewhere... Come to think of it, I haven’t seen Kruccu since last night."}]}

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （自由都市１での内容のおさらい、自由都市１でランス達は出会っている）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (A recap of the events in Free City 1, where Rance and others met.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 科学者、クソガキ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Scientist, brat

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 人造兵器を作る・・　シーザーの方がかっこいい
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Creating artificial weapons... Caesar's are cooler.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 特にやっかいのが衛星兵器・・ランスに協力してもらったバグうんぬん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The particularly troublesome one was the satellite weapon... the bugs that Rance helped with and all that.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: あれにはほんとてこずった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: That really gave us a hard time.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 後、メカバボラとかもあったな・・あれは強かったけど、やはりやばいのは衛星兵器だった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Also, there was Mecha Babora or something... that was strong, but the satellite weapon was definitely the most dangerous.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: でももう倒したら大丈夫。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: But since we defeated it, it’s alright now.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスがマリアに聞く、そういえばあの時、奴の作ったロボットの破片を回収したんだろ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance asks Maria, by the way, you recovered pieces of the robot he made back then, right?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 研究して何か分かったのか・・
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Did your research uncover anything?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うう、わかんないのー技術格差がある話
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ugh, I don’t know—there’s a technological gap, you see.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ５０名ほどの魔物軍と遭遇、チューリップを見ると逃げて行く
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Encountered a monster army of about 50; when they see the Tulip, they flee.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うわっ・・鉄のオバケだ・・あれは痛い、にげろー
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Whoa... an iron ghost... that’s dangerous, run!

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリアえっへん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria, ahem.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスが軽く言う
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance says lightly.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 役に立つ武器だ、ヘルマンとの戦いの時も強かった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s a useful weapon; it was strong even during the battle with Hellman.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: これに乗って戦うのは爽快だったぞ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Fighting while riding this was exhilarating.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: もっと早く、これを量産していればいいの、もったいない
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It would’ve been great if they mass-produced these sooner; such a waste.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: チューリップ１号だっけ、あの小型大砲や、２号という大型の固定大砲より
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The Tulip No.1, right? Compared to that small cannon and the larger fixed cannon called No.2,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ずっと役に立つだろう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: it’s much more useful.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: てな事を言うと、技術者の何かふれたらしく噛みつかれる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: When I say things like that, some engineer takes offense and bites back.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: わかってない
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They say I don’t understand.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 絶対に無理、材料、製造、メンテ等　大変
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s absolutely impossible—materials, manufacturing, maintenance, all are difficult.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それにこのＨ型の前のＧ型というタイプがあったのだけど
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Also, before this H model, there was a type called G model.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それはリーザスに納品した２両は１週間で動かなくなった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The two units delivered to Leesus stopped working within a week.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: やっとドイツ回路を発明してこのＨ型から安定してうんぬん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Finally, after inventing the German circuit, this H model became stable and so on.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それに１号は携帯用で、２号は大火力として圧倒的に有効で
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The No.1 is portable, and No.2 is overwhelmingly effective as heavy artillery,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: あれこれ・・どんどんいい
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and all that... it just keeps getting better.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ああ、やっかいな事をいってしまったな、よし話をかえよう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ah, I said something troublesome. Alright, let’s change the subject.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: これタイヤにしたらいいんじゃないか、馬車にあるような
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Wouldn’t it be better to make these into tires, like those on carriages?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: すると、キャタピラでないと駄目なのとうんちく
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Then they lecture me that it has to be caterpillar tracks.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 道中、チューリップ３号Ｈのキャタピラが外れる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: During the journey, the caterpillar track of Tulip No.3 H comes off.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 修理の為に休憩となる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They take a break to do repairs.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリアをおちょくる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Teasing Maria.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: パイアールが現れた、タンクを連れてきた。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: P.A.R. appears, bringing a tank with him.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 面倒だけど君のその戦車潰しておかないと大将軍が困るんだよ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s troublesome, but if we don’t destroy your tank, the Grand General will be in trouble.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリア　うてーうてー　かーんかーん　跳ね返される
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria: Shoot, shoot! Clang clang! It’s deflected back.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うたれてチューリップ大破、全然勝てない　マリア泣く
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Hit and the Tulip is heavily damaged; they can’t win at all. Maria cries.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 俺様がなんとかしてやる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I’ll do something about this.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスが攻め込む
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance launches an attack.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ああ、壊れちゃったよ。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ah, it broke.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 問題点は分かったし、しかたないなぁ新型作るよ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I understood the problems, so there’s no choice—I’ll make a new model.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: と立ち去る
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: And he leaves.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: こら、まてと追いかけるが逃げられてしまう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They chase after him saying “Hey, wait!” but he escapes.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: Ｍランド司令部
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: M-Land Headquarters

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリア、科学には科学だ、これを超える兵器を作るのだ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria, science with science—create a weapon that surpasses this.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: と壊れたタンクの破片を解析しているマリアに言う
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: He says this to Maria, who is analyzing the broken tank fragments.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ・・・やっぱり、わかんない、なにこれ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: ...Still, I don’t understand. What is this?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスはマリアに対抗手段を作れと命じる。お前なら出来る
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance orders Maria to create a countermeasure. 'You can do it.'

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 必死で作るが、出来ない・・　無能、アホとののしる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: She desperately tries but can’t do it... insulted as useless and idiot.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （マリアとは圧倒的な科学力の差）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (There’s an overwhelming technological gap compared to Maria.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そこにダークランスが現れる（マリアとは自由都市１で会っている）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Then Dark Rance appears (he met Maria back in Free City 1).

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 情けない男だ、これが俺の父親とは・・
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: What a pathetic man. To think this is my father...

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 女に頼って自分の力でなんとかしようとしないとはな
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Relying on a woman, not trying to manage things by his own strength.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: なにーとランスが怒るといなくなる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: When Rance gets angry and says 'What?!', he disappears.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （　マリア、ダークランスあたりの雰囲気で調整）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (Adjusting the atmosphere between Maria and Dark Rance.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: どこかに、そういやクルックーを昨晩からみないな
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Somewhere... Come to think of it, I haven’t seen Kruccu since last night.

translationLines.description: Array of objects, each representing a line from the input

originalJapaneseLine.description: The original line in Japanese exactly as it was in the input

translatedEnglishLine.description: The original line translated to English

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （自由都市１での内容のおさらい、自由都市１でランス達は出会っている）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (A recap of the events in Free City 1, where Rance and others met.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 科学者、クソガキ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Scientist, brat

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 人造兵器を作る・・　シーザーの方がかっこいい
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Creating artificial weapons... Caesar's are cooler.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 特にやっかいのが衛星兵器・・ランスに協力してもらったバグうんぬん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The particularly troublesome one was the satellite weapon... the bugs that Rance helped with and all that.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: あれにはほんとてこずった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: That really gave us a hard time.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 後、メカバボラとかもあったな・・あれは強かったけど、やはりやばいのは衛星兵器だった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Also, there was Mecha Babora or something... that was strong, but the satellite weapon was definitely the most dangerous.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: でももう倒したら大丈夫。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: But since we defeated it, it’s alright now.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスがマリアに聞く、そういえばあの時、奴の作ったロボットの破片を回収したんだろ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance asks Maria, by the way, you recovered pieces of the robot he made back then, right?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 研究して何か分かったのか・・
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Did your research uncover anything?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うう、わかんないのー技術格差がある話
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ugh, I don’t know—there’s a technological gap, you see.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ５０名ほどの魔物軍と遭遇、チューリップを見ると逃げて行く
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Encountered a monster army of about 50; when they see the Tulip, they flee.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うわっ・・鉄のオバケだ・・あれは痛い、にげろー
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Whoa... an iron ghost... that’s dangerous, run!

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリアえっへん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria, ahem.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスが軽く言う
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance says lightly.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 役に立つ武器だ、ヘルマンとの戦いの時も強かった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s a useful weapon; it was strong even during the battle with Hellman.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: これに乗って戦うのは爽快だったぞ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Fighting while riding this was exhilarating.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: もっと早く、これを量産していればいいの、もったいない
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It would’ve been great if they mass-produced these sooner; such a waste.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: チューリップ１号だっけ、あの小型大砲や、２号という大型の固定大砲より
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The Tulip No.1, right? Compared to that small cannon and the larger fixed cannon called No.2,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ずっと役に立つだろう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: it’s much more useful.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: てな事を言うと、技術者の何かふれたらしく噛みつかれる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: When I say things like that, some engineer takes offense and bites back.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: わかってない
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They say I don’t understand.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 絶対に無理、材料、製造、メンテ等　大変
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s absolutely impossible—materials, manufacturing, maintenance, all are difficult.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それにこのＨ型の前のＧ型というタイプがあったのだけど
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Also, before this H model, there was a type called G model.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それはリーザスに納品した２両は１週間で動かなくなった
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The two units delivered to Leesus stopped working within a week.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: やっとドイツ回路を発明してこのＨ型から安定してうんぬん
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Finally, after inventing the German circuit, this H model became stable and so on.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それに１号は携帯用で、２号は大火力として圧倒的に有効で
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The No.1 is portable, and No.2 is overwhelmingly effective as heavy artillery,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: あれこれ・・どんどんいい
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and all that... it just keeps getting better.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ああ、やっかいな事をいってしまったな、よし話をかえよう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ah, I said something troublesome. Alright, let’s change the subject.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: これタイヤにしたらいいんじゃないか、馬車にあるような
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Wouldn’t it be better to make these into tires, like those on carriages?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: すると、キャタピラでないと駄目なのとうんちく
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Then they lecture me that it has to be caterpillar tracks.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 道中、チューリップ３号Ｈのキャタピラが外れる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: During the journey, the caterpillar track of Tulip No.3 H comes off.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 修理の為に休憩となる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They take a break to do repairs.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリアをおちょくる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Teasing Maria.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: パイアールが現れた、タンクを連れてきた。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: P.A.R. appears, bringing a tank with him.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 面倒だけど君のその戦車潰しておかないと大将軍が困るんだよ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It’s troublesome, but if we don’t destroy your tank, the Grand General will be in trouble.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリア　うてーうてー　かーんかーん　跳ね返される
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria: Shoot, shoot! Clang clang! It’s deflected back.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: うたれてチューリップ大破、全然勝てない　マリア泣く
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Hit and the Tulip is heavily damaged; they can’t win at all. Maria cries.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 俺様がなんとかしてやる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I’ll do something about this.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスが攻め込む
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance launches an attack.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ああ、壊れちゃったよ。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Ah, it broke.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 問題点は分かったし、しかたないなぁ新型作るよ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: I understood the problems, so there’s no choice—I’ll make a new model.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: と立ち去る
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: And he leaves.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: こら、まてと追いかけるが逃げられてしまう
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: They chase after him saying “Hey, wait!” but he escapes.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: Ｍランド司令部
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: M-Land Headquarters

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: マリア、科学には科学だ、これを超える兵器を作るのだ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Maria, science with science—create a weapon that surpasses this.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: と壊れたタンクの破片を解析しているマリアに言う
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: He says this to Maria, who is analyzing the broken tank fragments.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ・・・やっぱり、わかんない、なにこれ
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: ...Still, I don’t understand. What is this?

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ランスはマリアに対抗手段を作れと命じる。お前なら出来る
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Rance orders Maria to create a countermeasure. 'You can do it.'

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 必死で作るが、出来ない・・　無能、アホとののしる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: She desperately tries but can’t do it... insulted as useless and idiot.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （マリアとは圧倒的な科学力の差）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (There’s an overwhelming technological gap compared to Maria.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そこにダークランスが現れる（マリアとは自由都市１で会っている）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Then Dark Rance appears (he met Maria back in Free City 1).

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 情けない男だ、これが俺の父親とは・・
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: What a pathetic man. To think this is my father...

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 女に頼って自分の力でなんとかしようとしないとはな
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Relying on a woman, not trying to manage things by his own strength.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: なにーとランスが怒るといなくなる
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: When Rance gets angry and says 'What?!', he disappears.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: （　マリア、ダークランスあたりの雰囲気で調整）
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: (Adjusting the atmosphere between Maria and Dark Rance.)

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: どこかに、そういやクルックーを昨晩からみないな
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Somewhere... Come to think of it, I haven’t seen Kruccu since last night.
